New Records: Thunder's 14-game win streak continues, tying the franchise record
Cavaliers' 30-4 start is the fourth best since 2000-01
Victor Wembanyama's performance in his 100th career game is historic
Key Match Events: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander shines with 33 points and seven assists
Aaron Wiggins goes off in the 4th quarter with 15 points and four 3s
Josh Hart pulls the Knicks back within five, but SGA responds with a clutch floater and two game-sealing free throws
Pre-Game Insights: The game is a clash of hot streaks with the Thunder and Knicks
The Cavs are the NBA-best team with a 30-4 record
Post-Match Reflections: SGA expresses pride in his team's effort
Karl-Anthony Towns and Jalen Brunson are clicking for the Knicks
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game is the fourth game in NBA history featuring two teams with win streaks of 9+ games
The second-longest win streak in the league belongs to the Cavs
Others: The game is a heavyweight bout with Playoff-like intensity
The victory draws the Thunder even with the 1995-96 SuperSonics for the longest win streak in franchise history
The Knicks' win streak is snapped at nine games
